questiontext.text:
Exercise 

Which of the following identities are correct?

generalfeedback.text:
Note the following

\( 1 - \tanh^2 x = 1 - \dfrac{\sinh^2 x}{\cosh^2 x} = \dfrac{\cosh^2 x - \sinh^2 x}{\cosh^2 x} = \dfrac{1}{\cosh^2 x} = \) \( \rm{sech}^2 \) \(x\).

To see that each of the other identities is incorrect, specify a particular value for \(x\) for which the identity is wrong. Also note that they are inconsistent with the above correct identities.
